column4: Just got done APT-geting hoary from warty... Should I have Xfree installed now or Org by default?
x.org I mean
indeed, Doi have X.org now or Xfree?
you will need to apt-get install xorg-common ...
either that or xserver-xorg
the deps don't want to take usually when dist-upgrading for whatever reason...
lynx for real sites... firefox for pr0n
ctrl alt f1 <-- that thing  :)
by default, you have 6 of them  :)
it sees the other instance of Samba... technically it is a linux network though in that instance...
you need to share things to see things  ;)
bah... nfs is simple... as is ftp...
already installed
its an in kernel thing...
should really direct him through menu's...
I've liked smb4k in the past... is Qt though...
GNOME folks don't seem to care much about Smb... always had issues via nautilus etc...
thats not really what he asked... bah
eh... just needs portmap, nfslock, and nfsserver loaded... (on both) ... and an entry in /etc/exports like: '/path/to/share * (perm_such_as_ro)'
'mount -t nfs -o soft IP:/path/you/shared /where/to/mount
can put an entry in fstab too... IP:/path/to/share /where/to/mount nfs defaults,soft 0 0
soft = terminate if source in unreachable... hard = crash my system please.
